Detailed Description

Character-set conversion functions.

I'm sure some (many?) people are wondering why this isn't a template class Well, at some point it probably will be, But not yet.

On windows, these functions use the builting API string conversions. On other operating systems, custom conversion routines are used, on the basis that the conversion is not all that difficult.

I'm going to claim that the definitions are pretty self-explanatory, so it should be possible to work out what is going on pretty easily.

The achar and astr types are used to allow us to change the internal character type at compile time, again, templates would also allow this.
